title: Fuel Prices Reduced By 15%
text:
17 July 2015 14:29 CET Fuel Prices Reduced By 15% By Daily Guide 
Prices of petroleum products have been reduced by 15 percent by the Oil Marketing Companies (OMC). 
The follows the recent fall in the price of crude oil on the world market and the appreciation of the cedi against the major foreign currencies. 
Per the new prices, a gallon of petrol is now being sold from GH¢15.00 to GH¢16.00 down from GH¢16.00 to GH¢18.00. 
The price of diesel went down by 19.85 percent and is currently selling at GH¢3.10p per litre from previous GH¢3.72 p per litre. 
The OMCs since June 16 have increased the prices of various petroleum products by close to 20 percent, as the National Petroleum Authority (NPA) took the first step towards the implementation of the full deregulation of the petroleum downstream sector. 
The increases, according to the OMCs, were largely due to the consistent drop of the cedi against the dollar and other major foreign currencies. 
There have been several calls for price reduction of about 24 percent since the recovery of the cedis. 
Per the new price deregulation policy, fuel prices would no longer be announced by the NPA. 
The Authority would, however, monitor the pricing by the OMCs to ensure that consumers are not cheated.
